title: Button onClick firing incorrect event
body:
<!--
  Note: if the issue is about documentation or the website, please file it at:
  https://github.com/reactjs/reactjs.org/issues/new
-->

**Do you want to request a *feature* or report a *bug*?**
bug

**What is the current behavior?**

- Have a form with a button of type submit and button of type button. 
- Have a state value init to false and show the "submit" button when its true and show the "regular" button when false. 
- Set onClick for the regular button to change state value to true showing the submit button. 
- The submit button will be fired even thought it wasn't clicked. 
See demo here: https://jsfiddle.net/hdgbr473/2/

**What is the expected behavior?**
The event should only be fired on the regular button not the submit button. 

**Which versions of React, and which browser / OS are affected by this issue? Did this work in previous versions of React?**
v16.8 / Chrome. unsure
